members.member: Represents an HTML attribute.
A single quote mark '
A double quote mark "
Represents an HTML comment.
Represents a complete HTML document.
Defines the max level we would go deep into the html document
Adds Debugging attributes to node. Default is false.
Defines if closing for non closed nodes must be done at the end or directly in the document. Setting this to true can actually change how browsers render the page. Default is false.
Defines if non closed nodes will be checked at the end of parsing. Default is true.
Defines if a checksum must be computed for the document while parsing. Default is false.
Defines the default stream encoding to use. Default is System.Text.Encoding.Default.

Defines if source text must be extracted while parsing errors. If the document has a lot of errors, or cascading errors, parsing performance can be dramatically affected if set to true. Default is false.
Defines the maximum length of source text or parse errors. Default is 100.
Defines if LI, TR, TH, TD tags must be partially fixed when nesting errors are detected. Default is false.
Defines if output must conform to XML, instead of HTML.
Defines if attribute value output must be optimized (not bound with double quotes if it is possible). Default is false.
Defines if name must be output with it's original case. Useful for asp.net tags and attributes
Defines if name must be output in uppercase. Default is false.
Defines if declared encoding must be read from the document. Declared encoding is determined using the meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html;charset=XXXXX" html node. Default is true.
Defines the name of a node that will throw the StopperNodeException when found as an end node. Default is null.
Defines if the 'id' attribute must be specifically used. Default is true.
Defines if empty nodes must be written as closed during output. Default is false.
Creates an instance of an HTML document.
Defines the max level we would go deep into the html document. If this depth level is exceeded, and exception is thrown.
Gets the document CRC32 checksum if OptionComputeChecksum was set to true before parsing, 0 otherwise.
Gets the document's declared encoding. Declared encoding is determined using the meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html;charset=XXXXX" html node.
Gets the root node of the document.
Gets the document's output encoding.
Gets a list of parse errors found in the document.
Gets the remaining text. Will always be null if OptionStopperNodeName is null.
Gets the offset of Remainder in the original Html text. If OptionStopperNodeName is null, this will return the length of the original Html text.
Gets the document's stream encoding.
Gets a valid XML name. Any text. A string that is a valid XML name.
Applies HTML encoding to a specified string. The input string to encode. May not be null. The encoded string.
Determines if the specified character is considered as a whitespace character. The character to check. true if if the specified character is considered as a whitespace character.
Creates an HTML attribute with the specified name. The name of the attribute. May not be null. The new HTML attribute.
Creates an HTML attribute with the specified name. The name of the attribute. May not be null. The value of the attribute. The new HTML attribute.
Creates an HTML comment node. The new HTML comment node.

Creates an HTML text node. The new HTML text node.

Detects the encoding of an HTML text. The input html text. May not be null. The detected encoding.

Gets the base URI for the current node. Always returns string.Empty in the case of HtmlNavigator implementation.
Gets the current HTML document.
Gets the current HTML node.
Gets a value indicating whether the current node has child nodes.
Gets a value indicating whether the current node has child nodes.
Gets a value indicating whether the current node is an empty element.
Gets the name of the current HTML node without the namespace prefix.
Gets the qualified name of the current node.
Gets the namespace URI (as defined in the W3C Namespace Specification) of the current node. Always returns string.Empty in the case of HtmlNavigator implementation.
Gets the associated with this implementation.
Gets the type of the current node.
Gets the prefix associated with the current node. Always returns string.Empty in the case of HtmlNavigator implementation.
Gets the text value of the current node.
Gets the xml:lang scope for the current node. Always returns string.Empty in the case of HtmlNavigator implementation.
Creates a new HtmlNavigator positioned at the same node as this HtmlNavigator. A new HtmlNavigator object positioned at the same node as the original HtmlNavigator.

Gets the value of the HTML attribute with the specified LocalName and NamespaceURI. The local name of the HTML attribute. The namespace URI of the attribute. Unsupported with the HtmlNavigator implementation. The value of the specified HTML attribute. String.Empty or null if a matching attribute is not found or if the navigator is not positioned on an element node.

Returns the value of the namespace node corresponding to the specified local name. Always returns string.Empty for the HtmlNavigator implementation. The local name of the namespace node. Always returns string.Empty for the HtmlNavigator implementation.

Determines whether the current HtmlNavigator is at the same position as the specified HtmlNavigator. The HtmlNavigator that you want to compare against. true if the two navigators have the same position, otherwise, false.

Moves to the same position as the specified HtmlNavigator. The HtmlNavigator positioned on the node that you want to move to. true if successful, otherwise false. If false, the position of the navigator is unchanged.

Moves to the HTML attribute with matching LocalName and NamespaceURI. The local name of the HTML attribute. The namespace URI of the attribute. Unsupported with the HtmlNavigator implementation. true if the HTML attribute is found, otherwise, false. If false, the position of the navigator does not change.

Moves to the first sibling of the current node. true if the navigator is successful moving to the first sibling node, false if there is no first sibling or if the navigator is currently positioned on an attribute node.
Moves to the first HTML attribute. true if the navigator is successful moving to the first HTML attribute, otherwise, false.
Moves to the first child of the current node. true if there is a first child node, otherwise false.

Moves the XPathNavigator to the first namespace node of the current element. Always returns false for the HtmlNavigator implementation. An XPathNamespaceScope value describing the namespace scope. Always returns false for the HtmlNavigator implementation.

Moves to the node that has an attribute of type ID whose value matches the specified string. A string representing the ID value of the node to which you want to move. This argument does not need to be atomized. true if the move was successful, otherwise false. If false, the position of the navigator is unchanged.

Moves the XPathNavigator to the namespace node with the specified local name. Always returns false for the HtmlNavigator implementation. The local name of the namespace node. Always returns false for the HtmlNavigator implementation.

Moves to the next sibling of the current node. true if the navigator is successful moving to the next sibling node, false if there are no more siblings or if the navigator is currently positioned on an attribute node. If false, the position of the navigator is unchanged.
Moves to the next HTML attribute.

Moves the XPathNavigator to the next namespace node. Always returns falsefor the HtmlNavigator implementation. An XPathNamespaceScope value describing the namespace scope. Always returns false for the HtmlNavigator implementation.
Moves to the parent of the current node. true if there is a parent node, otherwise false.

Moves to the previous sibling of the current node. true if the navigator is successful moving to the previous sibling node, false if there is no previous sibling or if the navigator is currently positioned on an attribute node.
Moves to the root node to which the current node belongs.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFAnnotDimension.LeaderLength
member.summary: The length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point; A negative value indicates the opposite direction. Default Value: 20F

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFAnnotDimension.LeaderOffset
member.summary: A non-negative number representing the length of the leader line offset, which is the amount of empty space between the endpoints of the annotation and the beginning of the leader lines. Default: 0F

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFAnnotDimension.LeaderExtend
member.summary: A non-negative number representing the length of leader line extensions that extend from the line proper 180 degrees from the leader lines. Default value: 6.67F

member.summary: If true, the text specified by the contents should be replicated as a caption in the appearance of the line. Default value: true.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFAnnotRedact.RegionPoints
member.summary: A list of PointF to indicate top/bottom lines for each redact region. Array length must be multiples of 8; and every 8 values to indicate a redact region. Format: x0, y0, x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3 while [x0, y0] is the top-left corner of the redact region, [x1, y1] is the top-right corner, [x2, y2] is the bottom-left corner and [x3, y3] is the bottom-right corner. All points in the page coordinates, which the origin is the upper-left corner of the page, and the unit of measure is pixel. Note: 1. y0 equals to y1 and y2 equals to y3 2. x0 less than x1, and x2 less than x3 Try to not set this property directly. Using SetRegions method instead.

member.name: T:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageRotate
member.summary: The value of the Rotate entry in Page dictionary must be a multiple of 90. All values could convert to 0, 90, 180 or 270.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageRotate.ANGLE_0
member.summary: The original page is rotated clockwise in 0 degree when displayed or printed.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageRotate.ANGLE_90
member.summary: The original page is rotated clockwise in 90 degree when displayed or printed. Eg. Top edge of the original page becomes to the Right edge.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageRotate.ANGLE_180
member.summary: The original page is rotated clockwise in 180 degree when displayed or printed. Eg. Top edge of the original page becomes to the Bottom edge.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageRotate.ANGLE_270
member.summary: The original page is rotated clockwise in 270 degree when displayed or printed. Eg. Top edge of the original page becomes to the Left edge.

member.summary: Page boundary type.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageBoundaryType.MediaBox
member.summary: Defines the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is to be printed. Content falling outside this boundary can safely be discarded without affecting the meaning of the PDF file.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageBoundaryType.CropBox
member.summary: Defines the region to which the contents of the page are to be clipped (cropped) when displayed or printed. Unlike the other boxes, the crop box has no defined meaning in terms of physical page geometry or intended use; it merely imposes clipping on the page contents.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageBoundaryType.BleedBox
member.summary: Defines the region to which the contents of the page should be clipped when output in a production environment.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageBoundaryType.TrimBox
member.summary: Defines the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPageBoundaryType.ArtBox
member.summary: Defines the extent of the pages meaningful content (including potential white space) as intended by the pages creator.

member.name: T:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionAlgorithmOption
member.summary: Specifies the encryption algorithm used in the document.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionAlgorithmOption.None
member.summary: The application does not decrypt data but directs the input stream to the security handler for decryption.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionAlgorithmOption.V2
member.summary: The application asks the security handler for the encryption key, and implicitly decryptes data with Algorithm 3.1 using RC4. Only available to V = 4.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionAlgorithmOption.AESV2
member.summary: The application asks the security handler for the encryption key, and implicitly decryptes data with Algorithm 3.1 using AES-128 in CBC mode with a 16-byte block size and a (random) init vector. The key size (Length) shall be 128 bits. Only available to V = 4.

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionAlgorithmOption.AESV3
member.summary: The application asks the security handler for the encryption key, and implicitly decrypts data with Algorithm 3.1a using AES-256 in CBC mode with a 16-byte block size and a (random) init vector. The key size (Length) shall be 256 bits. Only available to V = 5.

member.summary: This class provides APIs to handle all Optional Content related features, such as, - show default viewing optional content configuration - get all layer in a Document - render a PDFPage by given layer setting - add new layer to the page - combine one or more exist layers (to another layer) in the page - merge all alyers - update layer properties: name, default state

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFImageHandler.ReduceImageSize(RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument,RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFImage,System.Single)
member.summary: Reduce the original size of the image by the specified ratio. Eg. 2.0 means to reduce half pixels for both image width and height. Note: this method would not change the size of the image shown in the page.
member.param: Width (and height) ratio between original image and new image. Must be greater than 1.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFImageHandler.ReplaceImage(RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFPage,RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFImage,System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Replace the original image by a new image and keep the location and image size (in page) unchanged. Note: The width and height of the new image would be changed to fit the area of the original image. To avoid image distortion, width-height ratio of the new image is better to same to the ratio of the original image in the page (NOT the ratio of the embedded raw image resource).
member.param: The parent page of the image.

member.name: T:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions
member.summary: Specify objects to remove from the PDF file.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PDFDiscardOptions class.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardFormActions
member.summary: Disables all actions related to submitting or importing form data, and resets form fields; but it retains form objects to which actions are linked. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.FlattenFormFields
member.summary: Remove AcroForm fields with no change to their appearance. Form data is merged with the page to become page content. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardJavaScriptActions
member.summary: Removes all actions in the PDF that use JavaScript. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardAlternateImages
member.summary: Removes all versions of an image except the one destined for on-screen viewing. Some PDFs include multiple versions of the same image for different purposes, such as low-resolution on-screen viewing and high-resolution printing. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardPageThumbnails
member.summary: Removes page thumbnails. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardEmbeddedPrintSettings
member.summary: Removes embedded print settings, such as page scaling and duplex mode, from the document. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardEmbeddedSearchIndex
member.summary: Removes embedded search indexes. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardBookmarks
member.summary: Removes all bookmarks from the document. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardUnusedResourcesInPage
member.summary: Discard all resources in the page's Resource dictionary that have not been used in the page content (graphics operations); and then discard the related resource object(s) if the discard resources have not been used by any other pages. Default: false Note: 1. Set this flag to true would enable additional page content checking process. 2. It assumes a resource object can only be shared among pages, but not for other hosts such as XObject Form (inc. Annotations).

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardComments
member.summary: Removes all comments in the document. Annotations except Link, Redact, ??? ... Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardFormFields
member.summary: Removes all AcroForm fields in the document. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardMultimedia
member.summary: Removes all multimedia in the document. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardDocumentInfo
member.summary: Removes information in the document information dictionary. Default: false.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardMetadata
member.summary: Removes all metadata streams. Default: false.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardFileAttachments
member.summary: Removes all file attachments, including attachments added to the PDF as comments. Default: false Note: The attached files would not be optimized by SDK.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardExternalCrossRefs
member.summary:
Not support yet
Removes links to other documents. Links that jump to other locations within the PDF are not removed. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardPrivateData
member.summary: Strips information from a PDF document that is useful only to the application that created the document. This does not affect the functionality of the PDF.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.FlattenPageLayers
member.summary: Discard Hidden Layer Content And Flatten Visible Layers. The optimized document looks like the original PDF but doesnt contain any layer information. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardAllLinks
member.summary: Discard all link annotations Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.RemoveFlateCompression
member.summary: Remove all Flate compression in the file. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.UseFlateToEncodePlainStreams
member.summary: Applies Flate compression to all streams that are not encoded. Ignore if RemoveFlateCompression is true. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.UseFlateToReplaceLZW
member.summary: Applies Flate compression to all content streams and images that use LZW encoding. Ignore if RemoveFlateCompression is true. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardInvalidBookmarks
member.summary: Removes bookmarks that point to pages in the document that have been deleted. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardInvalidLinks
member.summary: Removes links that jump to invalid destinations. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.DiscardUnReferencedNamedDest
member.summary: Removes named destinations that are not being referenced internally from within the PDF document. Because this option does not check for links from other PDF files or websites, it does not fit in some workflows. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.OptimizePageContent
member.summary: Converts all end-of-line characters to space characters, which improves Flate compression. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDiscardOptions.OptimizeForFastWebView
member.summary: Restructures a PDF document for page-at-a-time downloading (byte-serving) from web servers. Default: false

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionLevel.RC4_128bit
member.summary: For Version 2 (Revision 3) Use RC4 symmetric key algorithms File Encryption Key length: 128 bits

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionLevel.RC4_40bit
member.summary: For Version 1 (Revision 2) Use RC4 symmetric key algorithms File Encryption Key length: 40 bits

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionLevel.AES_128bit
member.summary: For Version 4 (Revision 4), use AESV2 (AES-128) for CFM File Encryption Key length: 128 bits

member.name: F:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.EncryptionLevel.AES_256bit
member.summary: For Version 5 (Revision 5 or 6), use AESV3 (AES-256) for CFM File Encryption Key length: 256 bits

member.name: T:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting
member.summary: Specifies the properties of the password.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Set owner password and leave user password as empty. Characters in the password strings MUST be 8-bit char, or only lower 8-bit in the char would be used. For V is 4 or earlier, characters in the input string must be ASCII code. For V is 5, input string must be Unicode.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Characters in the password strings MUST be 8-bit char, or only lower 8-bit in the char would be used.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.HasUserPassword
member.summary: Flag of the user password.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.HasOwnerPassword
member.summary: Flag of the owner password.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.IsPrint
member.summary: Bit 3 (Revision 2) Print the document. (Revision 3 or greater) Print the document (possibly not at the highest quality level, depending on whether bit 12 is also set).

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.IsCopy
member.summary: Bit 4 Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by bits 6, 9, and 11.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.IsAnnot
member.summary: Bit 5 (Revision 2) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document, including extracting text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes). (Revision 3 or greater) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document by operations other than that controlled by bit 10.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.IsAssemble
member.summary: Bit 6 Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if bit 4 is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.IsExtract
member.summary: Bit 9 (Revision 3 or greater) Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if bit 6 is clear.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.IsFillForm
member.summary: Bit 10 (Revision 3 or greater) Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.IsModify
member.summary: Bit 11 (Revision 3 or greater) Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if bit 4 is clear.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.IsHighReso
member.summary: Bit 12 (Revision 3 or greater) Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated. When this bit is clear (and bit 3 is set), printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality. (See implementation note 25 in Appendix H.)

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.SetCopyingAndExtractionPermission(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set Allow Copy and Allow Extract together.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.SetAnnotAndFillFormPermission(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set Allow Annotation and Allow Fill AcroForm together.

member.summary: Set all permissions to true.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.PermissionAllForbiding
member.summary: Forbid all permissions.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.PermissionAllAllowedExceptExtration
member.summary: Set all permissions to true except Allow Extract.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PasswordSetting.Level
member.summary: Get and set the encryption level.

member.name: T:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption
member.summary: Specifies the options for text replace.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TextReplaceOption class.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.TextFont
member.summary: Font for the new text; set to null for using auto mode. Default: Arial, 12F, Regular

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.TextColor
member.summary: Color for the new text Default: Red

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.TextRotateAngle
member.summary: Set the rotate angle of the text direction in Device Space (Windows-like coordination). Eg.: 90 - text baseline from top to bottom; and text lines from right to left. Value range: 0 ~ 360 (excluding 360); otherwise, this property is ignored. Unit: in degree If UseHighPrecisionRotateAngle is false, this property must be a multiple of 5.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.UseHighPrecisionRotateAngle
member.summary: Indicate if use high precision mode for rotate angle. If this flag is false, the text rotate angle is accurate to 5 degrees; otherwise, the angle is accurate to 1 degree. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.IgnoreDescent
member.summary: Indicate if use the bottom left corner of the replacing region as the origin or not. True: baseline of the added string is just the bottom. False: baseline of the added string would be above the bottom that the distance would be the descent of the font. Default: false.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.TextHoriAlignment
member.summary: Alignment of the replace text in the specified region horizontally. The specified region is usually the first text region of the replaced text. This property used to determin the center point of the boundary of the replace text. It always uses the original text rotate angle (not the one defined by caller).

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.TextVertAlignment
member.summary: Alignment of the replace text in the specified region vertically. The specified region is usually the first text region of the replaced text. This property used to determin the center point of the boundary of the replace text. It always uses the original text rotate angle (not the one defined by caller).

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.UseReplacedTextFont
member.summary: Indicate if use the embedded font for the repalce text. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.EnableSubstituteChar
member.summary: Indicate if use substitute char or not when the replace character is not in the target embedded font. If this flag is false, it would not use the embedded font when any replace character is not in the embedded font. Only used if UseReplacedTextFont is set. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.TextReplaceOption.SubstituteChar
member.summary: Substitute symbol for unknown characters. Default: '?'

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFDocument.ImageReplaceOption.FitMode

member.name: T:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences
member.summary: Viewer Preferences This controlls the way the document is to be presented on the screen or in print.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PDFViewerPreferences class.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.Clone
member.summary: Clone method.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.HideToolbar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications tool bars when the document is active. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.HideMenubar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications menu bar when the document is active. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the documents window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the documents contents displayed. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to resize the documents window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.CenterWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to position the documents window in the center of the screen. Default: false.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the windows title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary (see Section 10.2.1, "Document Information Dictionary"). If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file containing the document. Default: false

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: The documents page mode, specifying how to display the document on exiting full-screen mode. This entry is meaningful only if the value of the PageMode entry in the Catalog dictionary is FullScreen; it is ignored otherwise. Valid Values: UseNone, UseOutlines, UseThumbs, UseOC. Default: PDFPageMode.UseNone

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.IsDirectionR2L
member.summary: The pre-dominant reading order for text. Default: false (L2R)

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.ViewArea
member.summary: The name of the page boundary representing the area of a page to be displayed when viewing the document on the screen. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used, as specified in Table 3.27. Default value: CropBox.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.ViewClip
member.summary: The name of the page boundary to which the contents of a page are to be clipped when viewing the document on the screen. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used, as specified in Table 3.27. Default value: CropBox.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.PrintArea
member.summary: The name of the page boundary representing the area of a page to be rendered when printing the document. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used, as specified in Table 3.27. Default value: CropBox.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.PrintClip
member.summary: The name of the page boundary to which the contents of a page are to be clipped when printing the document. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used, as specified in Table 3.27. Default value: CropBox.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.UsePrintScaling
member.summary: The page scaling option to be selected when a print dialog is displayed for this document. Valid values: None - which indicates that the print dialog should reflect no page scaling. AppDefault - which indicates that applications should use the current print scaling. If this entry has an unrecognized value, applications should use the current print scaling. Default: true (AppDefault)

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.Duplex
member.summary: The paper handling option to use when printing the file from the print dialog.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.PickTrayByPDFSize
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the PDF page size is used to select the input paper tray. This setting influences only the preset values used to populate the print dialog presented by a PDF viewer application. If PickTrayByPDFSize is true, the check box in the print dialog associated with input paper tray is checked. Default: as defined by the PDF viewer application.

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.PrintPageRange
member.summary: The page numbers used to initialize the print dialog box when the file is printed. The first page of the PDF file is denoted by 1. Each pair consists of the first and last pages in the sub-range. Note: - An odd number of integers causes this entry to be ignored. - Negative numbers cause the entire array to be ignored. Default: as defined by PDF viewer application. Note: SDK would not validate the input, it would save the setting to the PDF file.

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.GetPrintPageRangeString
member.summary: Get the print page range in string format. Eg.: "1,3,5-7,9"

member.name: P:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFViewerPreferences.NumCopies
member.summary: The number of copies to be printed when the print dialog is opened for this file. Supported values are the integers 2 through 5. Values outside this range are ignored. Default: as defined by PDF viewer application, but typically 1. Note: SDK would treat all values outside 2~5 as default (omitted the entry).

member.name: M:RasterEdge.XDoc.PDF.PDFTextMgr.AddString(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Int32,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.Color,System.Single)
member.summary: Add a string to a page with the specified font.
member.param: Page index of the target page.
Origin point of the character in the page. Unit: in pixel (96 dpi).

Rotate angle of the text direction in Device Space (Windows-like coordination). Valid: 0 ~ 360 (excluding 360) Default: 0 Eg. 90 - text baseline from top to bottom; and text lines from right to left. 180 - text baseline from right to left; and text lines from bottom to top. 270 - text baseline from bottom to top; and text lines from left to right.
